coincide.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to happen at the same time as something else, especially by chance
coincide.translation[0].definitions[0].e: When our vacations coincided, we often holidayed together.
The show is timed to coincide with the launch of a new book.
His entry to the party coincided with his marriage.
coincide.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if two peopleâ€™s ideas, opinions etc coincide, they are the same
coincide.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The interests of the US and those of the islanders may not coincide.
The cloth had a natural look which coincided perfectly with the image Laura sought.
coincide.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to meet or be in the same place
coincide.translation[0].definitions[2].e: The journey coincides in part with the Pennine Way.
